title: well..
content:
So far as I know, we've got a ton of staff here already.

Chogall is the guy who opened this board, and paid for its extra features long ago... he's away now and then on military stuff, but he does a good job of holding the fort down when he's around.

eK used to be really active in the community, but has since become more of a lurker--but he still steps in to help in a crisis, as he did during Shock's attacks. You can find him in the IRC channel, usually.

Ilsoap's not around as much as he used to be, but he's always been a good judge of what's going on, IMKO.

KeenRush has a bit of power in a few of the boards here, and he's proably THE most active guy in the Keen community. If anything, we should increase his power to all boards here...

I'm an admin (a deputy admin, actually) over at Keen:Modding, and while I like it, I feel that I don't quite use the power wisely yet. I've made mistakes, I've stepped on toes, and I worry that I'm a rules-lawyer sometimes. I'd rather not be a moderator on these boards.

Najawa and Harvey are both newbies, who have been here less than 6 months. The board's rule is that you can't get a custom title here untill you've got at least 314 posts, and have been around for 6 months... It'd be foolish to make someone a moderator who isn't even elligible for a custom title yet.

Malvineous I don't know enough about to vote either way. Sorry, Malv. :-)
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: well..
content:
"If anything, we should increase his power to all boards here..."
Agree. ([img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img] ) Then I could remove all the crap and give some punishment (in case I had admin status). Anyways, many times it would've been good if I had had mod priviledges to the forums I had not -- could've removed some stuff long before someone else came across.

Anyways, of those options I'd vote Xky (and actually did), he's done very good work at K:M.

And second would be Malvinous, he's reasonable dude.[url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

content:

title: well...
content:
On one hand, the fact that we only NEED an admin so rarely that we need emails / ICQ to get their attention shows how well-behaved and tidy our community is. We must get along pretty well if we don't need much management, eh?

On the other hand, it does cause problems when a rash of new members arrives without respect for the slower pace of this board. But really, KeenRush was posting about as frequently as the newbies when he first showed up--and then he settled down and has become the bitter mod-killer that we all know and love. :-)

Maybe if we give Harvey and Najawa some limitations to encourage them to settle down, they'll come to understand that 10 posts a day is actually a LOT for the Keen boards!

title: 10 Post!!! Limitations!!!
content:
Just 10 posts!!! that would be suffication!!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-bloody.gif[/img]

I'm tring to limit my posts.

10 posts a day... isn't that a bit strict: I'm getting better; I'm actually marking forums read, even If I don't post in them!!! Geese, but... I guess you do that all the time.

Garg!!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

Oh well... hey; I'm trying!!!

-- NAJAWA --

Heheh: I'm marking this forum read, instead of posting something!!! Wee!!!

title: awesome
content: Hey, you are trying, and it's definitely showing its effect.  Thanks for that.  :-)  Marking forums read is a good way to keep track of where you've been and what's new... and it helps you keep track of which threads are active, and which ones are dying.

content: IMKO = In My Keen Opinion. Like IMHO, except more Keenish - as IIRK (If I Remember Keenly) is to IIRC (If I Remember Correctly).
